author: Peerzada Ashiq
text:
PDP demands that some measures on agenda of alliance

The government formation in J&K seems to be stuck despite the recent talks between alliance partners, the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) and the BJP, which covered significant ground on the implementation of the ‘Agenda of the Alliance,’ the common minimum programme agreed to in February last year. “It’s a wait and watch policy for us as of now,” former State Finance Minister and PDP MLA Haseeb Drabu told The Hindu.

Mr. Drabu, assigned by PDP president Mehbooba Mufti to hold fresh parleys with the BJP over implementation of the alliance’s political, developmental and financial agendas, is “hopeful of a breakthrough on the government formation.”

“The talks were positive,” Mr. Drabu said. The PDP and the BJP, have failed to make any headway to stake claim for the government formation after the demise of CM Mufti Muhammad Sayeed on January 7.

Several PDP leaders told The Hindu that “they await the Centre’s move on issues discussed by Mr. Drabu with the BJP leadership.”

“We are yet to see any concrete measures on the ground,” PDP legislator and spokesman Nayeem Akhtar said.
title: No progress in J&K govt. formation
